incidentType: Database Breach - Mass Customer Data Exposure
attackMethod: Laravel framework vulnerability exploitation, CMS compromise
rootCause: Vulnerability in Laravel content management system, inadequate web security controls
impact: 41.5 million customers' personal data exposed including Aadhaar numbers, email IDs, home addresses; over 200GB of sensitive data leaked
description: Hathway, a major ISP and cable operator in India, suffered a massive data breach when hacker 'dawnofdevil' exploited vulnerabilities in the company's Laravel-based content management system. The breach exposed 12GB of customer data and 214GB of production data, making it one of the largest ISP breaches in India.

details.Targets: Hathway customer database, production systems, CMS infrastructure
details.Motivation: Data theft for potential financial gain and reputational damage
details.Consequence: Enhanced web application security, ISP sector security review

organization: Indian Government Entities and Energy Sector (Operation FlightNight)
incidentType: Advanced Persistent Threat - Cyber Espionage Campaign
attackMethod: Spear phishing with weaponized document, modified HackBrowserData malware, Slack C2 exfiltration
rootCause: Sophisticated APT campaign exploiting trust in official communications, inadequate email security
impact: 8.81GB of sensitive data exfiltrated from multiple government entities including defense, energy companies; financial documents, employee details, drilling activities compromised
description: Operation FlightNight, discovered by EclecticIQ, targeted Indian government agencies and energy companies using a modified information stealer. The attack used phishing emails masquerading as Indian Air Force invitations and utilized Slack channels for data exfiltration. Multiple agencies responsible for defense, IT, and energy infrastructure were compromised.

details.Actors: Unknown APT group conducting cyber espionage (medium confidence state-sponsored)
details.Targets: Indian defense agencies, energy companies, government IT infrastructure
details.Motivation: Strategic intelligence gathering on critical infrastructure
details.Consequence: Enhanced government email security, expanded APT threat monitoring

attackMethod: Server compromise, database access, telecom data extraction
rootCause: Inadequate server security, vulnerable telecom infrastructure
impact: 278GB of sensitive telecom data compromised including IMSI numbers, SIM card details, home location register data, security keys; second breach in 6 months
description: BSNL suffered its second major data breach within six months when threat actor 'kiberphant0m' accessed over 278GB of sensitive telecom data. The breach included server snapshots that could enable SIM cloning and extortion. This followed a December 2023 breach by 'Perell', indicating systemic vulnerabilities in India's state telecom provider.

details.Targets: BSNL telecom infrastructure, user databases, network configuration data
details.Motivation: Data theft for sale, potential SIM cloning operations
details.Consequence: Government inter-ministerial committee formed to audit telecom networks

incidentType: Smart Contract Exploit - Multi-Signature Wallet Hack
attackMethod: Exploitation of multi-signature wallet vulnerabilities, smart contract manipulation
rootCause: Smart contract vulnerabilities in wallet infrastructure, inadequate security auditing of DeFi protocols
impact: Over $230 million worth of cryptocurrency stolen including ETH, USDC, SHIB tokens; major disruption to Indian crypto ecosystem; trading suspended for weeks; 15 million users affected
description: WazirX, India's largest cryptocurrency exchange by volume, suffered a catastrophic exploit of its multi-signature wallet system on July 18, 2024. Attackers exploited vulnerabilities in smart contract logic to drain over $230 million in digital assets including Ethereum, USDC, and Shiba Inu tokens. The attack was linked to North Korean Lazarus Group using sophisticated social engineering and smart contract manipulation techniques.

details.Actors: Sophisticated cybercriminals with advanced blockchain expertise, attributed to Lazarus Group (North Korea)
details.Targets: WazirX multi-sig wallets, hot wallet infrastructure, DeFi smart contracts
details.Motivation: Financial theft - targeting high-value cryptocurrency assets
details.Consequence: Enhanced crypto exchange security regulations, mandatory cold storage requirements, increased regulatory scrutiny

details.Motivation: Financial extortion, hacktivism regarding denied medical claims
